<math alttext="open parentheses t equals 10 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>

December

<math alttext="open parentheses t equals 12 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>
 <math alttext="42.0"><mn>42.0</mn></math>

The average monthly high temperature, in degrees Fahrenheit (<math alttext="degree F"><mo>°</mo><mtext>F</mtext></math>), varies periodically for a certain city. The table gives the average monthly high temperature for selected months of the year. Based on a sinusoidal regression of these data, a model is constructed to predict average monthly high temperature as a function of time <math alttext="t"> <mi>t</mi> </math>, the number of the month of the year.
content.question: What is the average monthly high temperature predicted by the model for June <math alttext="open parentheses t equals 6 close parentheses"> <mfenced> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> </mfenced> </math> ?

topic.text: 3.7: Sinusoidal Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
